title: Ida python No module named tempo
content:
I tried to run tempo.py from ida python github , but I got error No module named tempo

According to Igor Skochinsky answer , this script is wrong

Apparently, tempo was an internal module used during IDAPython development. This sample should not have been released and will be removed.

I want to dump the registers and dump the memory of the process like they did in the script.

answers_data.content: Apparently, tempo was an internal module used during IDAPython development. This sample should not have been released and will be removed.

comments.text: Thanks, not I got error tempo has no attribute 'getregs' on this line L = tempo.getregs()
@paramikoooo sorry, I was wrong, see update
that strange, this example should work, no? so how can I implement that with the tools I have in Ida Python?
Implement what? Maybe you should ask what you actually need
dump the register, and dump the memory of process. I update my post. thanks
